meanings.definition: The act of unfolding or opening out.
meanings.sent1: The unfoldments of the map helped us find our way.
meanings.sent2: She carefully observed the unfoldments of the flower petals.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved unexpected unfoldments of colorful scarves.
meanings.sent4: The unfoldments of the mystery novel kept me guessing until the end.
meanings.sent5: The unfoldments of the origami demonstration were mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The process of revealing or making known.
meanings.sent1: The unfoldments of the investigation shocked everyone.
meanings.sent2: The unfoldments of the truth brought closure to the family.
meanings.sent3: The gossip magazine exaggerated the unfoldments of the celebrity scandal.
meanings.sent4: The unfoldments of history often shape our future.
meanings.sent5: The unfoldments of the experiment proved the hypothesis correct.

meanings.definition: The result of something being unfolded or revealed.
meanings.sent1: The treasure map led to exciting unfoldments for the adventurers.
meanings.sent2: The unfoldments of the surprise gift brought joy to her face.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected unfoldments of the plot twist left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The unfoldments of the secret plan were finally exposed.
meanings.sent5: The unfoldments of the grand reveal left everyone speechless.
